item.title: 3.3 Creating a Key Pair for SSH Connections
item.description: 3.3 Creating a Key Pair for SSH Connections Use SSH Key Pair instead of password to access the server instance. Key pair consists of a private key and a public key, the private key is kept on the user’s computer, and the public key must be registered when the server instance is created. To create a key pair, you need a key generation tool, if you don’t have one, you’ll use it after installation.
